Configuring Call Home Profile and Policy

You can set the call home profile.

To set the call home profile and policy, perform the following:

 1. In Call Home Profile, enter the required fields to create the Call Home Profile.

Figure 3-12 Call Home

 2. Click Recipient on recipient column, in Recipients Address enter the Email and click Add.

 3. Click Save and next to proceed further

Figure 3-13 Recipient

 

Table 3-6 Call Home Profile and Policy

Item

Description

Name

A user-defined name for this profile.

Alert Group

The group or groups that are alerted based on this Call Home profile. This can be one or more of the following:

 • Cisco Tac

 • Diagnostic

 • Environmental

Level

Faults that are greater than or equal to this level trigger the profile. This can be one of the following:

 • Critical

 • Debug

 • Disaster

 • Fatal

 • Major

 • Minor

 • Normal

 • Notification

 • Warning

Max Msg Size

The maximum message size that is sent to the designated Call Home recipients.

Enter an integer between 1 and 5000000. The default is 500000

Format

This can be one of the following:

 • Xml: A machine readable format that uses Extensible Markup Language (XML) and Adaptive Messaging Language (AML) XML schema definition (XSD). This format enables communication with the Cisco Systems Technical Assistance Center.

 • Full Txt: A fully formatted message with detailed information that is suitable for human reading.

 • Short Txt: A one or two line description of the fault that is suitable for pagers or printed reports.

Call Home Policy

State

If this field is Enabled, the system uses this policy when an error matching the associated cause is encountered. Otherwise, the system ignores this policy even if a matching error occurs. By default, all policies are enabled.

Cause

The event that triggers the alert. Each policy defines whether an alert is sent for one type of event.
